Config.Name: Time Zone
Config.Description: Set container to a desired timezone (usually same as this host)

Config.Name: Autostart Domains
Config.Description: Space separated list of domains that will be started along with the container if found powered off (case sensitive)

Config.Name: Ignored Domains
Config.Description: Space separated list of domains to exclude from backup schedule and automatic checks (case sensitive)

Config.Name: Backups Rotation (local)
Config.Description: Backups rotation: Number of checkpoints to save incrmentally into a backup chain before to archive it. If set to `0`, backup chain will grow indefinitely (and no retention policies will be applied)

Config.Name: Path for Backups (local)
Config.Description: Path to user share where all backups will be stored

Config.Name: Backup Schedule
Config.Description: Cron expression to schedule incremental backups

Config.Name: Retention Policy (local)
Config.Description: Local retention policy: How many backup chains to keep archived at `LOCAL_BACKUP_PATH`. If set to `0`, disables retention policy on the local endpoint

Config.Name: SSH Key
Config.Description: Path to private SSH key to perform operations onto remote servers via SSH and Rsync. Key must be owned by root and file permissions equal to '0600' (in most cases, necessary for send Unraid notifications)

Config.Name: Unraid IP/Hostname
Config.Description: Unraid IP/Hostname to send notifications (usually, same as this host). It has no effect on non-Unraid OS

Config.Name: Path for Backups (mirror)
Config.Description: Usually, a SSH address to a path into another host, where backup chains will be mirrored. Requires r/w permissions at the remote host. If not set, this feature remains disabled and `RSYNC_` env vars have no effect. (Read documentation for advanced usage)

Config.Name: Rsync Schedule
Config.Description: When a cron expression is set, backup mirrors are updated at this specific schedule, instead of immediately after backups schedule

Config.Name: Retention Policy (mirror)
Config.Description: Mirror's retention policy: How many backup chains to keep archived at `RSYNC_BACKUP_PATH`. If set to `0`, disables retention policy on the mirror

Config.Name: Fix Backup Chains After Interrupted Tasks
Config.Description: Attempts to repair backup chains when virtnbdbackup was interrupted in the middle of an operation, by removing the last checkpoint at both backup and domain, avoiding thus a forced rotation and creation of a new backup chain. (Set a non-empty value to enable)

Config.Name: Allow Automatic Powercycle of Domains
Config.Description: Performs controlled powercycle of running domains under certain scenarios during container startup. If not set, vm-babysitter will ask the user (via logs and Unraid notifications, when available) to manually shut down domains in need of this action. Read documentation for more info (Set a non-empty string to enable)

Config.Name: Check Backups Data Integrity
Config.Description: Verify data integrity of backups. This operation may take long time, delaying container's full initialization. Only useful under suspect of data corruption (Set a non-empty value to enable)

Config.Name: Domain Awaiting Timeout
Config.Description: Max amount in seconds scripts will await for domains responding to libvirt queries during powercycle operations. Increase this value if you get often warnings about scripts 'giving up' awaiting for slow domains

Config.Name: Virtnbdbackup Extra Arguments
Config.Description: Extra arguments passed to virtnbdbackup (only tested with `--start-domain`, `--compress` and `--no-color`. Other combinations usually lead to unexpected results

Config.Name: Rsync Extra Arguments
Config.Description: Extra arguments passed to Rsync

Config.Name: SSH Options
Config.Description: Common SSH options for communications with remote, and the unraid hosts (expert use only)

Config.Name: Internal Path for Backups
Config.Description: Container path where vm-babysitter will save and vm-restore will search for backups. Container will not start if not set, or if not mounted in r/w mode

Config.Name: Path for Domain Disk Images
Config.Description: Change only if domain disk images are stored into a different user share than the default

Config.Name: Main Path for Logs
Config.Description: Persistent bind mount for log files generated by scripts

Config.Name: Internal Main Log Path
Config.Description: Container path for the main log file

Config.Name: Internal Schedule Log Path
Config.Description: Container path for scheduled tasks log file

Config.Name: Internal Logrotate Config Path
Config.Description: Container path to place and read log rotation config

Config.Name: Logrotate Schedule
Config.Description: Cron expression to schedule internal logs rotation

Config.Name: Logrotate Settings
Config.Default:
compress
 copytruncate
 daily
 dateext
 dateformat .%Y-%m-%d.%H:%M:%S
 missingok
 notifempty
 rotate 30
Config.Description: Parsed string with *escaped* logrotate config to `LOGROTATE_CONFIG_PATH` during container (re)start

Config.Name: Virtnbdbackup Socket
Config.Description: Allows Virtnbdbackup to put its socket onto the main host

Config.Name: Libvirt API Socket
Config.Description: Allow scripts to read and interact with Libvirt socket from inside the container

Config.Name: Lock Folder
Config.Description: Allow scripts to put locks onto the main host

Config.Name: Path to Nvram Binaries
Config.Description: Allow scripts to read/restore per domain nvram binaries for EFI/UEFI boot

Config.Name: Path to OVMF Binaries
Config.Description: Allow scripts to read/copy common nvram binaries for EFI/UEFI boot
